page.title: 05THE WATER TOWER
page.content: As you drive up the road to Down St Mary from Morchard Road you pass a stone water tower.This is the second } tower to have been built on this site. The first fell down in the First World War and had to be rebuilt. They sank a well underneath the tower 200ft deep. They also built a pump house which had a petrol engine to bring up the water to the huge tower. It was used to provide water for two villages, Down St Mary and Morchard Road. It was closed down in 1960 because it couldn't serve both villages.
